answer_html: A hermitian matrix is a matrix \(A\) such that \(A=A^*\).A matrix that is its own conjugate transpose.All symmetric matrices with all real entries are hermitian.
answer_latex:
A hermitian matrix is a matrix $A$ such that $A=A^*$.A matrix that is
its own conjugate transpose.All symmetric matrices with all real
entries are hermitian.
question: 2 (a)
sols_html: A hermitian matrix is a matrix \(A\) such that \(A=A^*\). A matrix that is its own conjugate transpose. All symmetric matrices with all real entries are hermitian.
sols_latex:
A hermitian matrix is a matrix $A$ such that $A=A^*$. A matrix that is
its own conjugate transpose. All symmetric matrices with all real
entries are hermitian.
sols_raw: A hermitian matrix is a matrix <math>A</math> such that <math>A=A^*</math>. A matrix that is its own conjugate transpose. All symmetric matrices with all real entries are hermitian.
